profile_positions.description:
•	As a reliability engineer at SAPREF I was responsible for the Lubrication and Fuels unit. I have driven initiatives to improve reliability resulting in reduction of zones weighted unplanned downtime events from 9.28 days in 2020 to 2.44 days in 2021. This was achieved with strong reliability leadership and great collaboration amongst production, maintenance, engineering and technology teams.
•	I have championed the reliability mindset culture at the zone using visual representation of data to drive behavioral changes.
•	I was responsible for the collection of reliability performance data for KPI’s as well as monthly reporting and providing recommendations for improvement.
•	I have the ability to extract data from multiple sources (leveraging digital tools such as SQL, Power Bi and Excel), perform an analysis (using relative failure histograms, Pareto charts, Weibull, etc.)  and provide meaningful insights to identify the opportunities for improvement.
•	I am familiar with Root Cause Analysis, 5 why’s and Causal Leaning and have trained others through the development of training material and on the job coaching
•	I have identified and driven Defect Elimination projects in the zone and was responsible for the zones DE budget of R 5.5 million in 2021
•	Developed an asset improvement strategy for the site which began with the identification of critical assets, analysing the performance and failure history of these assets and identifying proactive maintenance to increase availability and equipment performance.
•	I am a clear, concise communicator who is persistent, resilient and willing to adapt to my environment. I am passionate about problem solving and continuous improvement.
•	I have facilitated and led various complex multi-disciplinary investigations across SAPREF and IV sites. Prepared reports, presentations and shared learnings across all layers of the organization (from Managing Director to the artisans and operators).

profile_positions.description:
As an Electrical Engineer working at Group Technology, Sasol my role is primarily to ensure that all electrical deliverables produced are of a high quality and meet client and legal requirements on various allocated projects. I personally conduct pre-feasibility and conceptual studies, whilst design work from basic engineering onwards is contracted out to an engineering house. I am responsible for reviewing all designs and electrical documentation and managing interfaces between electrical and other disciplines on projects. I perform my duties with minimal supervision. Below is a list of my key responsibilities and accomplishments:
•	I am lead electrical engineer on a number of air compliance projects within the Capital Projects and Small Projects portfolio’s
•	I conduct conceptual studies and infrastructure assessments during the Front End Loading stages of projects. Power availability, space constraints, ability to re-use existing equipment, technology selection and scope definition are considered during these studies
•	I give input into project Scope of Works / Works Information documents and am part of the technical bid evaluation process
•	I am able to use Microsoft Projects and  apply key scheduling concepts on projects
•	I have gained Construction Management experience on the  FTWEP WP3 project
•	I developed electrical input to project estimates on various tier 2 – 3 Capital Projects
•	I developed a Hold & Review Plan document which is used by electrical engineers in my function to identify and quantify quality review points on projects
•	I developed a Design Input Questionnaire document which is used by engineers in my function to agree on scope definition with the client during the FEL stages of a project to prevent Compensation Events and scope growth
•	Managed vacation work students, one of which won first prize amongst the third year students
•	Managed an Engineer in Training who successfully completed the Graduate Development Program
